Legal_Issue: Did the visa officer err in refusing the applicant's permanent residence application under subsection 75(2) of the Regulations?
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) Section 72
Evidence_Assessment: The officer ignored relevant evidence (AEO, Job Offer) and provided insufficient reasoning
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to prove past work experience matching NOC requirements
Legal_Rule: Subsection 75(2) requires applicants to prove past work experience matching NOC requirements; Subsection 75(3) mandates dismissal if not met
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider relevant evidence and lack of transparency in decision-making
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Decision lacked procedural fairness due to insufficient reasoning
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicant's claim of fulfilling NOC 6212 duties, AEO, Job Offer
Legal_Framework: IRPA, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Applicant_Challenge: Challenging refusal of permanent residence application
Court_Result: Case remitted for reconsideration by a different visa officer
Legal_Rule_Source: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, subsections 75(2) and 75(3)
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (AEO, Job Offer), Applicant testimony on work duties
Outcome: Application for judicial review allowed; decision set aside
Remedy_Sought: Reconsideration of application by a different officer
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 75(2) and 75(3) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet NOC 6212 work experience requirements
Applicable_Process: Permanent residence application under economic class
Governing_Rule: Subsection 75(2) and 75(3) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
